page.title: 01SOUTH EAST THATCHAM.
page.content: The area is mainly in the valley of the River Kennet with adjoining Kennet and Avon Canal ,both of which run from West to East.It is bordered on the North and South by hills rising to 125 metres,in which are small woodlands of deciduous and coniferous trees. About half of the area consists of seven farms. The rest is occupied by about sixteen large and smaller factories and a Royal Army Ordnance Depot.The rate of house building is dramatic.A primary school and a large comprehensive school,two churches and a cemetery also occpuy the area. Adjoining the river and canal and dividing the area in two is the main London to the West railway line. Futher North is the A4 road going from London to Bath, two B roads also run from North to South.
